May it please your good L. I am informed from my frindes out of
England,
that I have purchased displeasure aswell of yo
r
L. as of some other of
e
LL.
of her
Ma
ties
Councel: w
ch
doth growe as they suspect, through
the
Gouverno
r
of Ostend
. Because I knowe it not assuredly, but
only by report, I knowe not how to frame my stile, unto yo
r
L. But
if I have bin so unhappy, as to incurre yo
r
displeasure, about the Gouver-
nors affaires, I trust by yo
r
letters to be certefied of the cause, and mine
answear required: w
ch
is all that I will crave w
t
all submission of yo
r
L.
Whatsoever I have written of those matters of Ostend, it hath bin only
to yo
r
L. and not any thing to others, w
ch
God is witnes to my thought
I did for
e best, and w
t
a curious endevo
r
, to salve
e credit of
e
Gouverno
r
, and yet to take some good order for the indemnitie of the
Countrey. How I may have erred in the manner of my writing I cannot
conjecture, but for the matters advertised you shall not finde me to vary
from any point of any letter,
at I have written heertofore. And if
I adde more unto them, provoked therunto by
e unkindnes and practises
of
e Gouverno
r
and his frindes, (who doe injure me also otherwise, as I
am advertised) the blame must be there owne, that will force me of a
frinde, to become an accuser. I will not troble yo
r
L. with a multitude
of wordes in a matter of this qualitie, till I knowe in some certaintie for
w
at
occasion I am touched. But yet I besseeche you of your ever accusto
med, and honorable favor to suspend yo
r
judgment against me, till you
heare in w
at
sorte I can answear for my self. For if I be founde
to have written any thinge of Levitie, or malice, or not uppon suche
grounde, as all
e LL. w
t
out exception shall have cause to approove, I
will offer satsifaction to the uttermost point of shame,
at
e plaintifs
can require. And w
t
this my offer in
at behalfe, if yo
r
L. will vouchesafe
to acquaint the rest of the LL. if you thinke it so fitte, I will repute it
for a singular addition, to those other great good turnes, for w
ch
I am bounde
unto yo
r
L.
